text.eng: Marco\nGallery Designer
A local school has an art gallery that displays student works.
People are complaining about the gallery layout.
You need to redesign the gallery to address the complaints.
There are some design requirements for the gallery. When you redesign the gallery, you must include these requirements.\n\nThese requirements will be available to you during this entire task.
Marco, a gallery designer, will share four design requirements for this gallery.\n\nClick Next to review the four requirements.
An interactive kiosk is in the Main Gallery. Visitors should go directly to the Main Gallery to read artists' statements before viewing the show.
There is a fire exit in the Main Gallery. All side rooms must open into the Main Gallery in case of an emergency.
Visitors must be able to stand at least 12 feet away from a work of art.
Openings into the Main Gallery must be at least 6 feet wide (wide enough to fit three average-size adults standing side by side).
Click Requirements below to review Marco's design requirements.
You may propose the following changes to the partitions (the interior walls that divide the spaces):
Partitions can be moved.
Click the highlighted partitions to watch them move.
Partitions can be made longer or shorter.
Click the highlighted partitions to watch them shrink or grow in length.
Now it's time to review the 3 complaints about the gallery.
Your job will be to propose the best way to solve each problem.
To review Marco's requirements at any time, click Requirements below.
FIRST COMPLAINT
"I didn't know which room to go to next when I was in the Lobby."
Which way do I go?
SECOND COMPLAINT
"The North Gallery is too narrow. I couldn't stand back far enough to get a good look at the big painting on the wall."
I wish I could stand back a little farther.
THIRD COMPLAINT
"The opening to the North Gallery is too narrow. I had trouble getting around people."
Excuse me...
Let's consider the first complaint:
Remember the requirement that says:
An interactive kiosk is in the Main Gallery. Visitors should go directly to the Main Gallery to read artists' statements before viewing the show.
The correct way to view the gallery is to go straight from the Lobby to the Main Gallery.\n\nHow can you change the layout so people know to go straight from the Lobby to the Main Gallery?
Look at the following four suggestions.
You could move the partition between the Lobby and the Main Gallery to make the Lobby bigger.
Click the highlighted wall and watch it move.
You could narrow the opening between the Lobby and the Main Gallery.
Click the highlighted wall to narrow the opening.
You could close the opening between the Lobby and the South Gallery and make a new 6-foot wide opening.
Click the highlighted wall to close the opening. Other possible opening locations will appear.
You could make the South Gallery really dark so that it is unwelcoming to enter.
Click the South Gallery light switch to make it dark.
Select one of the suggested changes. Refer to the Requirements to help with your decision. When you are finished answering the question, click Submit.

The best suggestion is to close the opening between the Lobby and the South Gallery. That way, visitors entering the Lobby can only go into the Main Gallery.\n\nBut now you must propose a new opening into the South Gallery.
Look at the four proposed opening locations into the South Gallery.\n\nSoon you will select a new opening into the South Gallery.
Click each of the buttons below to view the four proposed 6-foot wide openings. After you've viewed all four openings, click Next.
Select a new way to enter the South Gallery.
In the space below, describe why you selected the opening you did. Use information in the design requirements to support your answer.\n\nWhen you are finished, click Submit.
Which design requirement, if any, does your selection violate? If none, click None.
Now that you have reviewed the design requirements, are you satisfied with the opening location you selected?
If you’re not satisfied, you may select a new way to enter the South Gallery.
Now that you have selected an opening into the South Gallery, let's consider the second complaint.
Which design requirement refers directly to this problem?
Marco thinks that moving the wall between the Main Gallery and the North Gallery will let people stand farther back from the art.
Now that the wall in the North Gallery has been moved, are you still satisfied with the opening location you selected for the South Gallery?
Select a new way to enter the South Gallery.
Marco thinks that 3 is the best door location.\n\nHe reminds you that all the side galleries must open directly into the Main Gallery.
Now let's consider the last complaint:

You must adjust the wall between the Main Gallery and the North Gallery to improve the opening between the rooms. Make sure you still have enough wall space to hang the paintings.\n\nClick Next to learn how to use the tools you will need.
Demo

To place an object, you will drag and drop it into the gallery space. The object's placement will be based on where you release it. When the person object changes from RED to BLUE, it can be dropped in a new location.
You can use this object to help you measure distance. Once placed in the gallery, the object will be scaled to the correct size.

To change the size of the opening, click the wall and hold the mouse button down. Then, move the wall to the right or the left. When you are happy with the size of the opening, release the mouse button.

Change the size of the opening into the North Gallery so that it follows the recommended design requirements. Click Tips to review instructions for using the person object and changing the opening.\n\nWhen you are finished, click Submit.

The correct width of the opening between the Main Gallery and the North Gallery is at least 6 feet wide (wide enough to fit three average-size adults standing side by side).\n\nClick Next to see the gallery with all improvements made to the space.
6 feet wide
On the right, you will see the layout of the gallery with all the improvements made to the space.
Review the complaints listed below and check off all that have been addressed by the new design.
Click all of the complaints that have been addressed. Then click Submit.
Thank you for helping redesign the student art gallery.
